t: John 6
The Fourth Sign: Feeding of the Five Thousand
After*p this, Jesus crossed the Sea of Galilee (or Tiberias).
A huge crowd was following him because they saw the signs that he was performing by healing the sick.
Jesus went up a mountain and sat down there with his disciples.
Now*p the Passover, a Jewish festival, was near.
So when Jesus looked up and noticed a huge crowd coming toward him, he asked Philip, “Where*r will*r we*r buy*r bread*r so*r that*r these*r people*r can*r eat?”*r
He asked this to test him, for he himself knew what he was going to do.
Philip*p answered him, “Two hundred denarii worth of bread wouldn’t be enough for each of them to have a little.”
One*p of his disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, said to him,
“There’s a boy here who has five barley loaves and two fish - but what are they for so many?”
Jesus*p said, “Have*r the*r people*r sit*r down.”*r There*p was plenty of grass in that place; so they sat down. The men numbered about five thousand.
Then Jesus took the loaves, and after giving thanks he distributed them to those who were seated - so also with the fish, as much as they wanted.
When*p they were full, he told his disciples, “Collect*r the*r leftovers*r so*r that*r nothing*r is*r wasted.”*r
So they collected them and filled twelve baskets with the pieces from the five barley loaves that were left over by those who had eaten.
When*p the people saw the sign he had done, they said, “This truly is the Prophet who is to come into the world.”
Therefore,*p when Jesus realized that they were about to come and take him by force to make him king, he withdrew again to the mountain by himself.
The Fifth Sign: Walking on Water
When*p evening came, his disciples went down to the sea,
got into a boat, and started across the sea to Capernaum. Darkness had already set in, but Jesus had not yet come to them.
A high wind arose, and the sea began to churn.
After they had rowed about three or four miles, they saw Jesus walking on the sea. He was coming near the boat, and they were afraid.
But he said to them, “It*r is*r I.*r Don’t*r be*r afraid.”*r
Then they were willing to take him on board, and at once the boat was at the shore where they were heading.
The Bread of Life

The*p next day, the crowd that had stayed on the other side of the sea saw there had been only one boat. They also saw that Jesus had not boarded the boat with his disciples, but that his disciples had gone off alone.
Some boats from Tiberias came near the place where they had eaten the bread after the Lord had given thanks.
When the crowd saw that neither Jesus nor his disciples were there, they got into the boats and went to Capernaum looking for Jesus.
When they found him on the other side of the sea, they said to him, “Rabbi, when did you get here?”
Jesus*p answered, “Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r you*r are*r looking*r for*r me,*r not*r because*r you*r saw*r the*r signs,*r but*r because*r you*r ate*r the*r loaves*r and*r were*r filled.*r

Don’t*r work*r for*r the*r food*r that*r perishes*r but*r for*r the*r food*r that*r lasts*r for*r eternal*r life,*r which*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r will*r give*r you,*r because*r God*r the*r Father*r has*r set*r his*r seal*r of*r approval*r on*r him.”*r
“What*p can we do to perform the works of God?” they asked.
Jesus*p replied, “This*r is*r the*r work*r of*r God -*r that*r you*r believe*r in*r the*r one*r he*r has*r sent.”*r
“What*p sign, then, are you going to do so that we may see and believe you?” they asked. “What are you going to perform?
Our ancestors ate the manna in the wilderness, just as it is written: He*i gave*i them*i bread*i from*i heaven*i to*i eat.”*i
Jesus*p said to them, “Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r Moses*r didn’t*r give*r you*r the*r bread*r from*r heaven,*r but*r my*r Father*r gives*r you*r the*r true*r bread*r from*r heaven.*r
For*r the*r bread*r of*r God*r is*r the*r one*r who*r comes*r down*r from*r heaven*r and*r gives*r life*r to*r the*r world.”*r
Then*p they said, “Sir, give us this bread always.”

“I*rp am*r the*r bread*r of*r life,”*r Jesus told them. “No*r one*r who*r comes*r to*r me*r will*r ever*r be*r hungry,*r and*r no*r one*r who*r believes*r in*r me*r will*r ever*r be*r thirsty*r again.*r
But*r as*r I*r told*r you,*r you’ve*r seen*r me,*r and*r yet*r you*r do*r not*r believe.*r
Everyone*r the*r Father*r gives*r me*r will*r come*r to*r me,*r and*r the*r one*r who*r comes*r to*r me*r I*r will*r never*r cast*r out.*r
For*r I*r have*r come*r down*r from*r heaven,*r not*r to*r do*r my*r own*r will,*r but*r the*r will*r of*r him*r who*r sent*r me.*r
This*r is*r the*r will*r of*r him*r who*r sent*r me:*r that*r I*r should*r lose*r none*r of*r those*r he*r has*r given*r me*r but*r should*r raise*r them*r up*r on*r the*r last*r day.*r

For*r this*r is*r the*r will*r of*r my*r Father:*r that*r everyone*r who*r sees*r the*r Son*r and*r believes*r in*r him*r will*r have*r eternal*r life,*r and*r I*r will*r raise*r him*r up*r on*r the*r last*r day.”*r
Therefore*p the Jews started grumbling about him because he said, “I*r am*r the*r bread*r that*r came*r down*r from*r heaven.”*r
They were saying, “Isn’t this Jesus the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How can he now say, ‘I*r have*r come*r down*r from*r heaven’?”*r
Jesus*p answered them, “Stop*r grumbling*r among*r yourselves.*r
No*r one*r can*r come*r to*r me*r unless*r the*r Father*r who*r sent*r me*r draws*r him,*r and*r I*r will*r raise*r him*r up*r on*r the*r last*r day.*r
It*r is*r written*r in*r the*r Prophets:*r And*ir they*ir will*ir all*ir be*ir taught*ir by*ir God.*ir Everyone*r who*r has*r listened*r to*r and*r learned*r from*r the*r Father*r comes*r to*r me -*r
not*r that*r anyone*r has*r seen*r the*r Father*r except*r the*r one*r who*r is*r from*r God.*r He*r has*r seen*r the*r Father.*r
“Truly*rp I*r tell*r you,*r anyone*r who*r believes*r has*r eternal*r life.*r
I*r am*r the*r bread*r of*r life.*r
Your*r ancestors*r ate*r the*r manna*r in*r the*r wilderness,*r and*r they*r died.*r
This*r is*r the*r bread*r that*r comes*r down*r from*r heaven*r so*r that*r anyone*r may*r eat*r of*r it*r and*r not*r die.*r

I*r am*r the*r living*r bread*r that*r came*r down*r from*r heaven.*r If*r anyone*r eats*r of*r this*r bread*r he*r will*r live*r forever.*r The*r bread*r that*r I*r will*r give*r for*r the*r life*r of*r the*r world*r is*r my*r flesh.”*r
At*p that, the Jews argued among themselves, “How can this man give us his flesh to eat?”
So*p Jesus said to them, “Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r unless*r you*r eat*r the*r flesh*r of*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r and*r drink*r his*r blood,*r you*r do*r not*r have*r life*r in*r yourselves.*r
The*r one*r who*r eats*r my*r flesh*r and*r drinks*r my*r blood*r has*r eternal*r life,*r and*r I*r will*r raise*r him*r up*r on*r the*r last*r day,*r
because*r my*r flesh*r is*r true*r food*r and*r my*r blood*r is*r true*r drink.*r
The*r one*r who*r eats*r my*r flesh*r and*r drinks*r my*r blood*r remains*r in*r me,*r and*r I*r in*r him.*r
Just*r as*r the*r living*r Father*r sent*r me*r and*r I*r live*r because*r of*r the*r Father,*r so*r the*r one*r who*r feeds*r on*r me*r will*r live*r because*r of*r me.*r

This*r is*r the*r bread*r that*r came*r down*r from*r heaven;*r it*r is*r not*r like*r the*r manna*r your*r ancestors*r ate -*r and*r they*r died.*r The*r one*r who*r eats*r this*r bread*r will*r live*r forever.”*r
He*p said these things while teaching in the synagogue in Capernaum.
Many Disciples Desert Jesus
Therefore,*p when many of his disciples heard this, they said, “This teaching is hard. Who can accept it?”
Jesus,*p knowing in himself that his disciples were grumbling about this, asked them, “Does*r this*r offend*r you?*r
Then*r what*r if*r you*r were*r to*r observe*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r ascending*r to*r where*r he*r was*r before?*r
The*r Spirit*r is*r the*r one*r who*r gives*r life.*r The*r flesh*r doesn’t*r help*r at*r all.*r The*r words*r that*r I*r have*r spoken*r to*r you*r are*r spirit*r and*r are*r life.*r
But*r there*r are*r some*r among*r you*r who*r don’t*r believe.”*r (For Jesus knew from the beginning those who did not believe and the one who would betray him.)
He said, “This*r is*r why*r I*r told*r you*r that*r no*r one*r can*r come*r to*r me*r unless*r it*r is*r granted*r to*r him*r by*r the*r Father.”*r
From*p that moment many of his disciples turned back and no longer accompanied him.
So Jesus said to the Twelve, “You*r don’t*r want*r to*r go*r away*r too,*r do*r you?”*r
Simon*p Peter answered, “Lord, to whom will we go? You have the words of eternal life.
We have come to believe and know that you are the Holy One of God.”
Jesus*p replied to them, “Didn’t*r I*r choose*r you,*r the*r Twelve?*r Yet*r one*r of*r you*r is*r a*r devil.”*r
He was referring to Judas, Simon Iscariot’s son, one of the Twelve, because he was going to betray him.
